key_title: Key to the species of Ficus

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Moraceae

leads.lead_text: Leaves glabrous and smooth above, margins entire; stipules usually more than 3 cm long; figs globose, glabrous, osteole minute; large trees with buttressed trunks, commonly planted as street trees
Leaves sparsely hispid above, margins subentire to toothed; stipules less than 2 cm long; figs subglobose, ellipsoid, ovoid or obovoid, hispid or puberulous, osteole raised; trees or shubs
Leaves deeply lobed, more than 5 cm wide; figs puberulous, usually pear-shaped, without lateral bracts; commonly grown, cultivated fruit tree, occasionally found on roadsides and near farmland
Leaves not lobed, mostly less than 5 cm wide; figs hispid, ellipsoid to ovoid, with scattered lateral bracts; restricted to rainforest in the far east of Victoria
